page.title: 19Living in Coleshill,150 yrs.
page.content: My name is Alexander Holdsworth and my family have lived in Coleshill for over 150 yrs.My GGG grandfather, William Leason came to Coleshill in 1839 and worked repairing clocks.He began making church clocks,in what was known as a Clock-yard.Altogether William had 7 sons,only one of these was born in Coleshill.After a while business died out because cheap foriegn clocks were being made,so William became a Publican,keeping the Clock Inn.My GGGGG grandfather was Richard Pearch.He was born in 1754 and died in 1840.He was married to Elizabeth Cashmore and they lived in Workhouse Lane and had 5 children. I plan to live in Coleshill for the rest of my life and perhaps live in the house my family have lived in for 6 generation,no22,Coventry Rd. Coleshill.
